channel.title: Pvp Zone
channel.description:
Can someone show me how to make a certain spot pvp
Ex) [img]http://i.imgur.com/QeKe1tS.png[/img]
I want the outside of camelot to be pvp but only like maybe 30 x 30 squares though or 20x20 not to many

item.title: Pvp Zone
item.dc:creator: @Kjloveday Kjloveday
item.description:
@Kjloveday wrote:

nevermind i fixed it BUT this shows help me please i want it to say like wild level 10

Read full topic

item.title: Pvp Zone
item.dc:creator: @Coldmedicine Coldmedicine
item.description:
@Coldmedicine wrote:

How rude can one get?
This kind sir helped you, and thats how you thank him?

His name clearly is not “sk8erdude”…
sk8rdude461 is his name, and he shall be known as so.

RUDE!

if (absX > CORNERLEFT && absX < CORNERRIGHT && absY > CORNERLEFTUNDER && absY < CORNERRIGHTTOP) {
return true;
}

item.title: Pvp Zone
item.dc:creator: @Kjloveday Kjloveday
item.description:
@Kjloveday wrote:

sorry for late reply no time lol but ok so i found this

which cords do i change if i want like

I want pvp to be from X:2773, Y:3481 to X: 2743, Y: 3468

i don’t quite understand this pvp script

amy help at all is appreciated and thank you “sk8erdude” for the help.

Read full topic

item.title: Pvp Zone
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Zymus:

Oh, I’m not implying that you were. I just wanted to make sure that you weren’t saying that camelot is between, (0, 0) and (31, 31)

Sorry wasn’t trying to come off as rude (text can do that…) I was just saying

Read full topic

item.title: Pvp Zone
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:548579”][quote author=Zymus link=topic=667491.msg4463995#msg4463995 date=1419020193]

public boolean inPVP() { return (absX > 0 && absX < 31 && absY > 0 && absY < 31); }

if(c.inPVP()) c.sendOption("Attack", 3);

That’s basically it…

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/help/275495-pi-pvp-wilderness-area-2.html
^Has some data on it…
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/441392-quick-way-make-pvp-pi-noob-friendly.html
^this too

I think that code would only work if the player’s absolute coordinates were somewhere between (0, 0) and (30, 30). I think the coords for camelot are something like (1400, 3700). So you would need to change those values.

Also, side note, I think it’s a bit silly to have a random event system like that. It wouldn’t be difficult for a user to modify the client slightly to have a chatbox listener, and then do something like

final String plaintext = message.getPlainText();
if (plaintext.startsWith("[Random Event]") && plaintext.contains("::")) {
    final int startIndex = plaintext.indexOf("::");
    final int stopIndex = plaintext.indexOf(" ", startIndex);
    final String response = plaintext.substring(startIndex, stopIndex);
    sendCommand(response);
}

[/quote]

I’m not here to supply working code. I’m here to help… He can get the coords himself, I’ve provided a boolean to use as an exoskeleton… and examples…[/quote]

Oh, I’m not implying that you were. I just wanted to make sure that you weren’t saying that camelot is between, (0, 0) and (31, 31)

Read full topic

item.title: Pvp Zone
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:3, topic:548579”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=667491.msg4463992#msg4463992 date=1419019493]

public boolean inPVP() { return (absX > 0 && absX < 31 && absY > 0 && absY < 31); }

if(c.inPVP()) c.sendOption("Attack", 3);

That’s basically it…

http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/help/275495-pi-pvp-wilderness-area-2.html
^Has some data on it…
http://www.rune-server.org/runescape-development/google/snippets/441392-quick-way-make-pvp-pi-noob-friendly.html
^this too
[/quote]

I think that code would only work if the player’s absolute coordinates were somewhere between (0, 0) and (30, 30). I think the coords for camelot are something like (1400, 3700). So you would need to change those values.

Also, side note, I think it’s a bit silly to have a random event system like that. It wouldn’t be difficult for a user to modify the client slightly to have a chatbox listener, and then do something like

final String plaintext = message.getPlainText(); if (plaintext.startsWith("[Random Event]") && plaintext.contains("::")) { final int startIndex = plaintext.indexOf("::"); final int stopIndex = plaintext.indexOf(" ", startIndex); final String response = plaintext.substring(startIndex, stopIndex); sendCommand(response); } [/quote]

I’m not here to supply working code. I’m here to help… He can get the coords himself, I’ve provided a boolean to use as an exoskeleton… and examples…

Read full topic

Also, side note, I think it’s a bit silly to have a random event system like that. It wouldn’t be difficult for a user to modify the client slightly to have a chatbox listener, and then do something like
